DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study examine influence step goal pedometer improve child 's weight loss , physical activity , psychosocial health behavioral treatment . Children overweight obesity assign receive behavioral treatment alone , plus pedometer , plus pedometer step goal .
DOC.detailed_description: A total 105 overweight obese child age 8 17 year participate 10-week family-based weight management intervention focus physical activity , nutrition , behavioral modification . A quasi-experimental design use group cohort three condition : two cohort pedometer ( n=24 ) ; two cohort pedometer ( n=25 ) ; four cohort pedometer step goal ( i.e . 500 steps/day weekly increase baseline ; n=56 ) . Height weight measure baseline week 10 used calculate body mass index ( BMI ) . Analysis covariance perform examine difference condition change weight , BMI , BMI z-score , control age baseline value . Differences steps/day psychosocial health compare two pedometer condition .
DOC.criteria: Aged 817 year old BMI ≥ 95th percentile BMI ≥ 85th percentile comorbidities ( e.g . hypertension , heart disease , type 2 diabetes , insulin resistance , sleep apnea , orthopedic problem , fatty liver disease )
